locations.name: Ibeno Beach
locations.description: One of the longest beaches in West Africa, known for its peaceful environment, ocean breeze, and soft white sand ideal for relaxation.

locations.name: Oron Museum
locations.description: Historic museum showcasing Ekpu wood carvings, traditional relics, and colonial artifacts from the rich cultural history of the Oron people.

locations.name: Slave Bridge
locations.description: A historic site where slaves were led to ships, featuring preserved dungeons and a symbolic bridge with deep emotional and historical significance.

locations.name: Ibom Plaza
locations.address: Ikot Ekpene Rd, Uyo, Akwa Ibom
locations.description: Urban square with an open-air theatre, beautiful fountain, and the iconic Ibom Connection monument attracting locals and tourists alike.

locations.name: Four Points Hotel
locations.description: Premium hotel by Sheraton offering luxury rooms, fine dining, event spaces, and a relaxing atmosphere in the heart of Ikot Ekpene.

locations.name: Worship Centre
locations.address: Udo Udoma Ave, Uyo, Akwa Ibom
locations.description: One of the largest worship halls in southern Nigeria, known for vibrant services, gospel events, and massive Christian gatherings.

locations.name: Dakada Tower
locations.description: Modern high-rise building symbolizing Akwa Ibom's economic growth, located in a fast-developing district of Uyo city.

locations.name: Akpabio Stadium
locations.address: Ikot Ekpene Rd, Uyo, Akwa Ibom
locations.description: International-standard stadium with 30,000 seats, used for football matches, concerts, athletics, and national events in Uyo.
